III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The Wedgwood East Campus Building is a newly constructed two story, 56-bed facility. It
replaces the Wedgwood Cutlerville Campus building that was quickly falling into disrepair and
also posed numerous supervision challenges because of the layout of the living units in an
old hospital ward. The old facility also lacked sufficient lounge and recreation areas to
accommodate the needs of programs operating at capacity.
The Crossroads Program [CI410201082], the Summit Program [CI410201502], and the
Pathfinder-Delta Program [CI410201359] are moving from the Cutlerville Campus to the new
Wedgwood East Campus. They will maintain their program names, but be incorporated into
one license. The Pathfinder Program [Formerly male residents] and the Delta Program
[Formerly female residents] will occupy the 28 bed co-ed living unit on the 2nd floor. This living
unit has two female bedroom hallways and two male bedroom hallways. Most bedrooms are
singles, but there is a three-bed, male bedroom and a three-bed, female bedroom. The living
area is a very large room and includes a kitchen area. There are no blind spots or areas that
would be difficult to supervise. The entire program is monitored by cameras with the wiring in
place to upgrade to sound monitoring. All bedroom doors are alarmed to insure that residents
cannot leave their rooms without staff knowledge. Because there is no staff office, staff
operate from a counter in the center of the living area. From the counter the staff are able to
see down all four bedroom hallways as well as being able to supervise the entire daytime
living area without blind spots. There are two secure classrooms on the second floor that will
be operated by Kentwood Public Schools.
The first floor is divided into two living units. To the left of the front door is the 16 bed
Crossroads Program, a non-secure, male adolescent sexual offender treatment program. It
has two, three-bed bedrooms and ten single bedrooms. The design of the program is similar
to the upstairs layout with cameras, high resident visibility in a large dayroom, no staff office,
and secure classrooms. To the left is the second living unit. It is the secure, co-ed Summit
Program for the treatment of substance dependent and addicted teens. The layout of this
2

program is a mirror of the Crossroads Program, except that it has one, three bed bedroom
and eleven single bedrooms.
All of the programs have numerous large windows that look out over large open areas. All
furniture is new and there is more than sufficient space for residents to maintain separate
activities.
In addition to the new residence building, Wedgwood has added a bistro club operated by the
chaplaincy and a resident and staff health club. The grounds have been expanded to include
a fenced pond, benches, and paved walking trail. Driveways and parking areas have been
significantly reduced in areas near the residential buildings.
B. Program Description
All four programs have moved from the Cutlerville Campus to the East Campus without
changes to programming or policy.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
NONE
The facility has been given approval for occupancy by Duane Dimet of the Bureau of Fire
Services. Additional temporary restrictions on the occupancy include:
a. No storage in the any of the four storage rooms / janitors rooms since they do not have
the B-labeled fire doors.
b. No use of the behavioral management room that is missing the glass in the door
c. One phone in each of the four pods must be working before occupancy. At the time of
the fire inspection, three pods had not yet been wired for phone service.
d. There must be a policy / procedure in place to keep all of the exits shoveled.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that a new program, provisional license be issued to this newly
constructed, child caring institution.
